arabicText: بِسۡمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحۡمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِیمِ سَأَلَ سَاۤىِٕلُۢ بِعَذَابࣲ وَاقِعࣲ

translations.en: ONE who is minded to ask might ask about the suffering which [in the hereafter] is bound to befall
translations.ar: بِسۡمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحۡمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِیمِ سَأَلَ سَاۤىِٕلُۢ بِعَذَابࣲ وَاقِعࣲ

translations.en: those who deny the truth. [Know, then, that] nothing can ward it off,
[since it will come] from God, unto whom there are many ways of ascent:

arabicText: تَعۡرُجُ ٱلۡمَلَـٰۤىِٕكَةُ وَٱلرُّوحُ إِلَیۡهِ فِی یَوۡمࣲ كَانَ مِقۡدَارُهُۥ خَمۡسِینَ أَلۡفَ سَنَةࣲ

translations.en: all the angels and all the inspiration [ever granted to man] ascend unto Him [daily,] in a day the length whereof is [like] fifty thousand years…
translations.ar: تَعۡرُجُ ٱلۡمَلَـٰۤىِٕكَةُ وَٱلرُّوحُ إِلَیۡهِ فِی یَوۡمࣲ كَانَ مِقۡدَارُهُۥ خَمۡسِینَ أَلۡفَ سَنَةࣲ

translations.en: Therefore, [O believer,] endure all adversity with goodly patience:
behold, men look upon that [reckoning] as something far away –
but, We see it as near!
[It will take place] on a Day when the sky will be like molten lead,
and the mountains will be like tufts of wool,
and [when] no friend will ask about his friend,

arabicText: یُبَصَّرُونَهُمۡۚ یَوَدُّ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمُ لَوۡ یَفۡتَدِی مِنۡ عَذَابِ یَوۡمِىِٕذِۭ بِبَنِیهِ

translations.en: though they may be in one another's sight: [for,] everyone who was lost in sin will on that Day but desire to ransom himself from suffering at the price of his own children,
translations.ar: یُبَصَّرُونَهُمۡۚ یَوَدُّ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمُ لَوۡ یَفۡتَدِی مِنۡ عَذَابِ یَوۡمِىِٕذِۭ بِبَنِیهِ

translations.en: and of his spouse, and of his brother,
and of all the kinsfolk who ever sheltered him,

arabicText: وَمَن فِی ٱلۡأَرۡضِ جَمِیعࣰا ثُمَّ یُنجِیهِ

translations.en: and of whoever [else] lives on earth, all of them - so that he could but save himself.
translations.ar: وَمَن فِی ٱلۡأَرۡضِ جَمِیعࣰا ثُمَّ یُنجِیهِ

translations.en: But nay! Verily, all [that awaits him] is a raging flame,
tearing away his skin!
It will claim all such as turn their backs [on what is right], and turn away [from the truth],
and amass [wealth] and thereupon withhold [it from their fellow-men].
VERILY, man is born with a restless disposition.
[As a rule,] whenever misfortune touches him, he is filled with self-pity;
and whenever good fortune comes to him, he selfishly withholds it [from others].
Not so, however, those who consciously turn towards God in prayer.
[and] who incessantly persevere in their prayer
and in whose possessions there is a due share, acknowledged [by them],
for such as ask [for help] and such as are deprived [of what is good in life];
and who accept as true the [coming of the] Day of Judgment;

arabicText: وَٱلَّذِینَ هُم مِّنۡ عَذَابِ رَبِّهِم مُّشۡفِقُونَ

translations.en: and who stand in dread of their Sustainer's chastisement –
translations.ar: وَٱلَّذِینَ هُم مِّنۡ عَذَابِ رَبِّهِم مُّشۡفِقُونَ

translations.en: for, behold, of their Sustainer's chastisement none may ever feel [wholly] secure;
and who are mindful of their chastity,

arabicText: إِلَّا عَلَىٰۤ أَزۡوَ ٰ⁠جِهِمۡ أَوۡ مَا مَلَكَتۡ أَیۡمَـٰنُهُمۡ فَإِنَّهُمۡ غَیۡرُ مَلُومِینَ

translations.en: [not giving way to their desires] with any but their spouses - that is, those whom they rightfully possess [through wedlock] -: for then, behold, they are free of all blame,
translations.ar: إِلَّا عَلَىٰۤ أَزۡوَ ٰ⁠جِهِمۡ أَوۡ مَا مَلَكَتۡ أَیۡمَـٰنُهُمۡ فَإِنَّهُمۡ غَیۡرُ مَلُومِینَ

arabicText: فَمَنِ ٱبۡتَغَىٰ وَرَاۤءَ ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ فَأُو۟لَـٰۤىِٕكَ هُمُ ٱلۡعَادُونَ

translations.en: whereas such as seek to go beyond that [limit] are truly transgressors;
translations.ar: فَمَنِ ٱبۡتَغَىٰ وَرَاۤءَ ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ فَأُو۟لَـٰۤىِٕكَ هُمُ ٱلۡعَادُونَ

translations.en: and who are faithful to their trusts and to their pledges:
and who stand firm whenever they bear witness;
and who guard their prayers [from all worldly intent].
These it is who in the gardens [of paradise] shall be honoured!
WHAT, THEN, is amiss with such as are bent on denying the truth, that they run about confusedly to and fro before thee,
[coming upon thee] from the right and from the left, in crowds?

arabicText: أَیَطۡمَعُ كُلُّ ٱمۡرِئࣲ مِّنۡهُمۡ أَن یُدۡخَلَ جَنَّةَ نَعِیمࣲ

translations.en: Does every one of them hope to enter [by this means] a garden of bliss?
translations.ar: أَیَطۡمَعُ كُلُّ ٱمۡرِئࣲ مِّنۡهُمۡ أَن یُدۡخَلَ جَنَّةَ نَعِیمࣲ

translations.en: Never! For, behold, We have created them out of something that they know [only too well]!

arabicText: فَلَاۤ أُقۡسِمُ بِرَبِّ ٱلۡمَشَـٰرِقِ وَٱلۡمَغَـٰرِبِ إِنَّا لَقَـٰدِرُونَ

translations.en: But nay! I call to witness [Our being] the Sustainer of all the points of sunrise and sunset: verily, well able are We
translations.ar: فَلَاۤ أُقۡسِمُ بِرَبِّ ٱلۡمَشَـٰرِقِ وَٱلۡمَغَـٰرِبِ إِنَّا لَقَـٰدِرُونَ

arabicText: عَلَىٰۤ أَن نُّبَدِّلَ خَیۡرࣰا مِّنۡهُمۡ وَمَا نَحۡنُ بِمَسۡبُوقِینَ

translations.en: to replace them with [people] better than they are; for there is nothing to prevent Us [from doing what We will].
translations.ar: عَلَىٰۤ أَن نُّبَدِّلَ خَیۡرࣰا مِّنۡهُمۡ وَمَا نَحۡنُ بِمَسۡبُوقِینَ

arabicText: فَذَرۡهُمۡ یَخُوضُوا۟ وَیَلۡعَبُوا۟ حَتَّىٰ یُلَـٰقُوا۟ یَوۡمَهُمُ ٱلَّذِی یُوعَدُونَ

translations.en: Hence, leave them to indulge in idle talk and play [with words] until they face that [Judgment] Day of theirs which they have been promised –
translations.ar: فَذَرۡهُمۡ یَخُوضُوا۟ وَیَلۡعَبُوا۟ حَتَّىٰ یُلَـٰقُوا۟ یَوۡمَهُمُ ٱلَّذِی یُوعَدُونَ

arabicText: یَوۡمَ یَخۡرُجُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡأَجۡدَاثِ سِرَاعࣰا كَأَنَّهُمۡ إِلَىٰ نُصُبࣲ یُوفِضُونَ

translations.en: the Day when they shall come forth in haste from their graves, as if racing towards a goal-post,
translations.ar: یَوۡمَ یَخۡرُجُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡأَجۡدَاثِ سِرَاعࣰا كَأَنَّهُمۡ إِلَىٰ نُصُبࣲ یُوفِضُونَ

arabicText: خَـٰشِعَةً أَبۡصَـٰرُهُمۡ تَرۡهَقُهُمۡ ذِلَّةࣱۚ ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ ٱلۡیَوۡمُ ٱلَّذِی كَانُوا۟ یُوعَدُونَ

translations.en: with downcast eyes, with ignominy overwhelming them: that Day which they were promised again and…
translations.ar: خَـٰشِعَةً أَبۡصَـٰرُهُمۡ تَرۡهَقُهُمۡ ذِلَّةࣱۚ ذَ ٰ⁠لِكَ ٱلۡیَوۡمُ ٱلَّذِی كَانُوا۟ یُوعَدُونَ
